definition: to take part in/to participate/to join/to attend/to counsel/unequal/varied/irregular/uneven/not uniform/abbr. for 參議院|参议院 Senate, Upper House

sentences.english: In which year did he join the army?
Graham joined the army to get away from a boring job.
sentences.chinese: 格雷厄姆参军以逃脱烦闷的工作。

sentences.english: Men also join the military in disproportionate numbers.
sentences.chinese: 男性参军的数目也不成比例。

sentences.english: So, straight out of high school, he enlisted in the Navy for four years.
sentences.chinese: 因此，高中一毕业，他就报名参军当了四年的海军。

sentences.english: I was classified unfit to serve.
sentences.chinese: 于是我被划为不宜参军的人。

sentences.english: He has distinguished himself many times at the risk of life since he joined the army.
sentences.chinese: 他参军以来，出生入死屡建功劳。

sentences.english: To defend their country, many young people of that village joined the army.
sentences.chinese: 为了保卫祖国，那个村子里的很多年轻人参军入伍。

sentences.english: He lied about his age to join the army.
sentences.chinese: 他为了参军谎报了年龄。

sentences.english: The most valuable component of ournational defense is the men and women who make up America’s all-volunteer force.
sentences.chinese: 我们国防最珍贵的组成部分是自愿参军的国民。

sentences.english: He was only seventeen when he joined the army.
Entering the navy as a volunteer, he served in the Dutch Wars and became post captain in 1673.
sentences.chinese: 他志愿参军，在英荷战争中成为上校舰长。

sentences.english: To send children to the army helps cultivate their independence and self-control.
sentences.chinese: 送孩子去参军有助于培养他们的独立和自理能力。

sentences.english: If it's Zouave, I'm damned if I'll go in the troop.
sentences.chinese: 要是采用法国步兵服呢，那我再去参军就活该了。

sentences.english: As soon as war was declared,many men volunteered.
sentences.chinese: 一经宣战，就有许多人自愿参军。

sentences.english: Harry joined the army and became a member of battery.
sentences.chinese: 哈里参军了，成为炮兵连的一员。

sentences.english: Even though they were not yet citizens, they had enlisted.
sentences.chinese: 他们在尚未成为美国公民时便参军入伍。

definition: to enlist/to serve in the army
to serve in the army/to be a soldier
to join up/to enlist (e.g. in the military)
to lay down the pen and take up the sword (idiom)/to join the military (esp. of educated person)
to be discharged from military service
to enlist/to be in the army
general/high-ranking military officer/to check or checkmate/fig. to embarrass/to challenge/to put sb on the spot
Chiangchun township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
to change one's profession/to transfer to civilian work
